ocr_text:
Secrets of Gosu: Understanding Physical Combat
Skills of Professional Plavers in First-Person Shooters
Eunji Park 1 , Sangyoon Lee 1 , Auejin Ham 1,2
Minyeop Choi 1 , Sunjun Kim 2 , Byungjoo Lee 3
KAIST 1 , DGIST 2 , Yonsei University 3
YONSEI UNIVERSITY
DGIST
KAIST
speech_text: Hi, my name is Eunji from KAIST. Today I will talk about this topic, Secrets of Gosu, understanding physical combat skills of professional players in first-person shooters.

name: CHI-473DF-0051500.jpg
ocr_text:
Why First Person Shooters?
Fast reaction,
Accurate aiming, ...
Combat skills
"Gosu"
How the player performs better?
speech_text: The first-person shooter, called FPS, requires very fast reaction time to check the opponent's position, and the user has to aim the opponent accurately using their mouse. Like this, the individual's combat skills has a very huge influence on the win or loss of the game. And as you know, professional players dominate the combat skills of normal players. We call them Gosu, not only professional players, but who has a much high performance. Then how and why the Gosu perform better than the other players?

Research Goals

Researchers

Verify the conjectures from the online communities Analyze what makes the differences in the player's combat skill
speech_text: In the research field, many previous studies have analyzed FPS and gamers from diverse perspectives. But many research questions were different from what actual gamers want to know. So in this study, as researchers and passionate gamers, we aimed to verify the conjectures from the online communities and analyze what makes the difference in the player's combat skill.

speech_text: we measured the angular velocity of mouse to find out how fast players snap their wrist when performing the flicking aim. And we measured the rotation ratio of elbow and wrist to verify the conjecture most professional players use arm aiming rather than wrist aiming.

Gameplay Logging System
Six behavioral Sensors + in-game data logger
Behavioral data - Eight motion capture cameras, an eye tracker EMG sensors, a pulse sensor, an analog Input keyboard, and a dual sensor mouse
In-game data - Player data (position of the player, enemy player's skeletal position, player's health, etc) - Game events (player_death, weapon_fire, weapon_reload, player_jump, player_zoom, etc)
speech_text: In order to collect data to measure metrics, We developed a gameplay logging system with six types of behavior or sensors, and in game data logger system we used eight motion capture cameras. eye tracker, EMG sensors, pulse sensor, keyboard, and a dual sensor mouse. name: CHI-473DF-0268350.jpg
ocr_text:
User study
Method
Motivation
Verified Conjectures
"Most professional players have their own sensitivity.
"Most professional players use arm
aiming rather than wrist aiming"
"Most professional players use low
sensitivity"
speech_text: conjectures are verified. Among them, I picked some interesting points to introduce. Please refer to our paper for other detailed results and information. First, professional players were more familiar with their mouse sensitivity so that they showed less corrective movements just before the shooting. Also, professional players tended to use more elbows than the wrists during aiming, and the rotation ratio was higher than the amateurs. Lastly, professional players' sensitivity was low and they used a larger area of the mousepad.

name: CHI-473DF-0305000.jpg
ocr_text:
User study
Method
Motivation
So, what is the origin of the Gosu's high performance?
Some results are related to the mouse sensitivity or setting
-> Influence of game interface
Professional players showed shorter reaction times
-> Influence of innate cognitive ability
speech_text: Through these results, we revealed two interesting points about the origin of the high performance of professional players. First, we inferred that the influence of game interface could affect the combat strategies. This is because professional players' mouse sensitivity was lower, so they had to move the mouse larger to move the same distance as the other player who used the high sensitivity. Second, we deduced that the high performance of professional players may be due to their innate cognitive ability, because professional players showed lower reaction time in our study.

name: CHI-473DF-0311000.jpg
ocr_text:
Take-away Notes
1) We verified the conjectures what actual gamers want to
know based on the quantitative metrics
2) We presented the collected dataset and data-logging code to
the public for future research.
Thank you! Any questions or comments?
